Do Perennialists believe in low-maintenance gardening?

Do Perennialists believe in low-maintenance gardening?

 
 Hmm...well I don't think it's more of that, but more of "if it ain't broke why fix it?" I must say though, I'm somewhat of a Perennialist. I think concepts and ideas of the past are important because well, that's how we got to where we are today. I have always liked classes like that, instead of those focusing on strange new ideas that really just made class...boring and unlearning, IMHO.
